website_summaries.verdict: A great overall external hard drive from LaCie designed for heavy desktop use.
pros: Large exterior case is slender enough to fit on most desks or even next to a laptop for extra storage
Comes with Adobe Creative programs for photo editing
cons: Advertised top speeds are difficult to achieve without a Thunderbolt 3 connection

customer_reviews.title: Oddly, You can't contact LaCie.  Yrust me, don't say can't be true.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, I am returning a product I've used many times in past because LaCie's new management has NO way to reach them: they are telling me that my phone number is invalid. I know, eyes rolling, she must be doing this wrong, but I am not (I finally called my coworkers to ask them if I was losing my mind). And there is no way to reach them for product support on the issue without giving them my phone number (even via email) so I cannot contact them so I am returning this very expensive drive. Was a wonderful wonderful company, bought by Seagate, which is a dive company, and now they are taking LaCie down with them.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Smiles

customer_reviews.title: Casing is just for show, drive is trash
customer_reviews.text: Terrible drive, died in less than a month being stationary. I never write reviews but was so disappointed in what I thought would be a quality drive. Stick to Wd.
customer_reviews.author: Tramaine

customer_reviews.title: Contradiction of terms
customer_reviews.text: Nice, solid, quite and reliable. While a Thunderbolt 3 device, this is essentially a standard external SATA hard drive with a USB-C T3 connecting cable. The theoretical 40GB of transfer rate are structurally unachievable due to the sped limit of the HD. So, expect 220+MBps regardless of the Thunderbolt 3 interface. Totally expected and the raring 3 out of 5 reflects the disconnection between the T3 component and its real performance. Wished laCie had made available the cache card offered for the T2 version
customer_reviews.author: smaruzzi

customer_reviews.title: Best and longest warranty and highest speed except for SSD
customer_reviews.text: Very quite; I can't hear it unless next to my ear. 5 yr limited warranty & 5 yr data recovery warranty. Using XCopy /s, I copied 54 videos 39.65 GB from my SSD internal drive with the following results: LaCie D2 Profissional 6TB: 2 min 51 seconds - 232 MB/s Glyph Black Box Pro 6TB: 4 min 32 seconds - 146 MB/s (7200 rpm drive) G-Drive Mobile USB C 4TB: 7min 37 seconds - 87 MB/s (5400 rpm drive) Doesn't appear to have on/off switch. However, the mean time between failure if running 24/7 is 31 years so I see no reason to turn if off when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: D. C. Wornock

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST!!!
customer_reviews.text: Quick, quite, stays cool, 5 year warranty. I replaced the factory USB A to C cable with a GEN II from Monoprice. Wasn't really needed but I'm OCD, from Drag Racing. UPDATE: 11/15/2018 ( I'm getting another, 6TB this time ) What does that tell you.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Karpook

customer_reviews.title: I lost my whole data and they couldn't recover it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the drive used it when I travel to my home and take it back with me. When I came back the drive stopped responding. I sent them back to them to try to recover the data and they said the disk was damaged beyond recovered. I was shocked that this happened and would expect La Cie drive to be more robust. I packed the drive in a well protect suite case and didn't not expect this to happen. Don't buy this. The drive is too expensive and too fragile and it not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Panas Wiwatpanachat

customer_reviews.title: Careful - Disk "disappears" and so does technical support
customer_reviews.text: Not my first LaCie but quite possibly my last. Drive mounted to my iMac (2017) and worked brilliantly for 2 weeks....then one morning, the drive couldn't be found. The LaCie toolkit (see photo) certainly could see it but said it had "no partiions" and there was no way to reformat the drive. Reached out to LaCie tech support and they gave me a case number but the phone number they provided does not work....what?? So I tried reaching them other ways....nothing works. I've had great luck with their drives in the past, their support however, it terrible. Just fair warning.
customer_reviews.author: CCG65

customer_reviews.title: LaCie products are simply dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I have had dozens of external drives but only two from LaCie. BOTH DRIVES FAILED. The most recent, this one, failed within 2 days of delivery. Whatever you do, stay away from LaCie. If your backups or data are important to you, find a better product. Thank goodness it failed after copying the first round of files and not after I backed up my entire system.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Ward

customer_reviews.title: Arrived dead but replacement ok. (Update)
customer_reviews.text: DOA, plugged it in and - nothing. Due to pandemic I couldn't get to immediately after I got it (March) so had to contact Amazion, who is going to exchange it. This one was a dud so proceed with caution. Update. New one works well. Might have been a faulty outlet.
customer_reviews.author: jg

customer_reviews.title: Secure backup.
customer_reviews.text: Speedy and enough capacity. Fairly small desktop footprint. My only concern is the lack of an on/off switch. I use the drive for backups (but not time machine) and do not leave my backup drives booted/running continuously. After doing a backup, I unmount the drive, and then pull the power plug to have it completely disconnected from the mains. Not the smoothest solution but workable.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D.

customer_reviews.title: No replacement parts for faulty interface, but a happy ending
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: After several email exchanges with the new owner (Seagate) they have offered to replace my original d2 drive with a newer version. This is great. Thank you Seagate. ++++++++++++++++++++++++++== I bought this to go along with a previous d2 6TB version for my mac. The 6 TB version recently stopped working because the builtin thunderbolt interface died. Several emails to tech support revealed that no parts are available to replace the interface. Of course it was out of warranty. Luckily the hard disc can be easily removed and put into another interface.
customer_reviews.author: Cricket

customer_reviews.title: So far Excellent...!
customer_reviews.text: Other drives I tried massively suck... Western Digital and whatever. They make noise, etc. I used my Maxtor I and III external drives for like 15 years without issue, but they are too small now. So far, this Lacie is nice and quiet, and it's nice to have the speeds with the newer connection type, Type-C or whatever. Hope it lasts... I'll likely be purchasing another if this.
customer_reviews.author: leeuniverse

customer_reviews.title: Inexplicably and unpredictably disconnects from Mac running Catalina
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying LaCie since the 90s. I've loved their products, but this drive is slowly changing my enthusiasm. About once a day it disconnects from my Mac (running Catalina) and there's no way to reconnect unless I cycle power to the hard drive. The Apple Support Community seems to have plenty of other customers with the same problem. Exhausting. Sadly, this will probably be my last LaCie purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Hard Drive never turns on / wakes up
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive is perpetually "on" as in it hums and vibrates letting you know something is going on inside. I believe they call it "sleep mode". However, it never wakes up. Not when powered off and then turned back on. Not when connected to a computer. Not when the blue button is pressed for short or long periods of time. It will turn on (aka blue blinking light) sometimes, but whenever it wants, not when you want/need it to, just long enough for you to load your data onto it, but then never access that data again.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Scales

customer_reviews.title: That Giant Blue Eye!
customer_reviews.text: Great size. Good response time. Cool form factor. But let's talk about the elephant in the room. That GIANT blue eye is truly a distraction if you sit facing your hard drive, as I do. It's very bright, and of course blinks when the drive is actively engaged. I'd buy it again, but I'd do just as I've done this time. Cover up the giant blue eye.
customer_reviews.author: King Neptune

customer_reviews.title: Speed and Quality
customer_reviews.text: As of having it for 1 month I haven't had any problems as of now. USB-C is insanely fast compared to my old G Drive that crashed before I decided to get this. I'll update this later once production is finished to see how well it holds up to crunch time. Update: This product has withstood the time of a film production and recommend it to all who want a trusted hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a fine thing!
customer_reviews.text: I have a good experience with my 3 x LaCie Thunderbolt 1 Little Big Disk 2TB for many years. As I moved to the new iMac 27 with Thunderbolt 3, so I have bought 2 x LaCie d2 Thunderbolt 3 8TB. There are some points to be mentioned. - The LED is brighter than the old models. It draws the attention. Good and bad. - One of them failed at the start up. The LED blinked with the red light. I had to restart the system and it came back with blue. It has happened twice since I have bought them 3 weeks ago. But their performance and design have met my expectations in overall.
customer_reviews.author: Jae

customer_reviews.title: Good speed transfer
customer_reviews.text: It's good product, i like the speed transfer and it seems as stable drive. I hold my Final Cut Pro project on it and edit them directly form drive, seems to be fast enough for HD video. It was easy to set up the drive and i like that they include different different pug adapters for different outlets. That is convenient for travel. The only problem with this drive i had is a big blue light on it, which doesn't shut down in sleep mode, so i had to put a type over it, because it would disturb me at a dark room.
customer_reviews.author: Vlad D

customer_reviews.title: Really hoped this was my next multi year HD, but no.
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed as I have other LaCie products and the work very well. This particular HD would lock up my Lightroom catalog whenever I tried to export an image. Good thing it was the beginning of a new 2020 catalog, and the last three years worth of work that I’d indented to transfer over.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J. Landon

customer_reviews.title: Good value but Hal 9000 warning
customer_reviews.text: For the money, it’s a good value. No issues with dependability or it doing what I need it to do. My one and only complaint is the Hal 9000 blue light the unit has that is obnoxious. It is way too bright and has no use whatsoever for the unit. What’s more, for creatives who prefer a dimly lit office, it is straight up distracting. Prepare to use some electricians tape or some kind of cover to blot it out. The drive is still a good value but I’d love to see the intern who designed it into this thing fired for such bad UX.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great backup drive for extra storage space.
customer_reviews.text: I use this drive as backup for my NAS. LaCie has a reputation for quality and reliability. The 10TB model contains an Iron WolfPRO drive. It is a very good drive. I use the drive 24x7x365. No issues. I hope to get many years of use out of it. The light is a bit bright, but where I have it, it is not an issue. The 8TB drive is faster than the 10TB drive. It is still a very fast drive.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Sears

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived on time but was not new. The item looked like it had been returned before then sold again. The drive would not even power on. Total waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Better
customer_reviews.text: If you want an external hard drive you can rely on look no further. I have purchased multiple LaCie d2 drives over the years and have found them to be a highly reliable drive. I currently have four LaCie Drives in use to backup my home Synology NAS. These LaCie drives give me 100% backup reliability should I ever experience a NAS drive failure. I HIGHLY recommend these drives for home user.
customer_reviews.author: Alan S. James

customer_reviews.title: Don't use for mac unless you format it.
customer_reviews.text: LaCie drives used to be good. But this one that is cross-platform has a lot of problems. If the disc is not ejected properly, you won't be able to plug it back in and use it again, The only fix is to load it on a pc, and then run the repair since the mac first aid repair does not work on it. Simply updating your mac software will cause the system to restart and the disc to show as it was not ejected properly. My guess is that this has something to do with the way it's formatted to work on both mac and pc. It uses exFAT format.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Amazing drive, amazing company
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using LaCie drives for years. I had bought a G Drive to use as a backup for my new laptop, and had issues right out of the box (see my profile for my review on it). Turned right back to my old trusty friend LaCie and this one worked perfectly. About 10 years of using LaCie drives both the rugged and desktop ones and they never have failed me. Their customer support is awesome too, on an old drive I’d busted the thunderbolt port and they sent me a new drive even tho it was slightly out of warranty. Highly recommend buying this drive and anything from LaCie!
customer_reviews.author: CaitlinBarnett

customer_reviews.title: High quality hard drive that looks great and offers good speeds.
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality hard drive. Setting the drive up and registering was a breeze after running the setup that was included with the drive. I bought the 10TB drive to backup files from my company and after seeing the quality of the drive itself we will more than likely invest in one of their larger drives when we fill this one. I have an older generation Macbook Air so I needed to buy the thunderbolt 3 to 2 adapter. The drive came with a power cable (along with cables that match foreign outlets), a TB3 cable, and a USB 3 to TB3 cable in case you don't have a TB3 port.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M.

customer_reviews.title: Drive had an internal power malfunction quickly after buying it
customer_reviews.text: I would never spend the extra cash on a LaCie drive again. They are NOT easy to get fixed and the company is not very helpful. I connected the drive to my new Mac and it sat on my desk for just over one month before it died. The company said it has an internal power failure and offered to send me a new drive, but that will take over a MONTH! Wow such bad customer service. And I had filled it up with tons of data that is now gone. Would NOT recommend this drive to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money, it’s sleek and robust.
customer_reviews.text: This is a beast but the speed is not at all what I would have expected from a “Pro” device. With it being connected via a usb-c thunderbolt 3, it’s still a spin disc, so don’t get all too excited for speed. However, it’s really nice, clean looking, and robust. Handles professional workflow nicely. I currently use it all day everyday to work from, anything from 3D graphics, design, web development, photography, composting and more. Wish it was faster.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Disk failure can’t be repaired.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in July 2019. Sep 2019 Just rec’d a message that macOS can’t repair the disk. I have about 4TB of backup data on the 10TB drive. I can open the files but cannot change them. MAC recommends back ASAP. SAD. Hope seller will contact me an provide a replacement under standing I am past the return date, but what about warranty replacement?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Product But Makes A Slight Noise?
customer_reviews.text: WHAT DID I LIKE ABOUT THIS PRODUCT? - Plug & Play. Easy to connect. - Data Transfer is transferred at a decent speed - I like the design as it fits into the thin spaces WHAT I DIDN'T LIKE ABOUT THE PRODUCT? - It makes a 'noise' when being used. More like a CD is spinning inside. - I did post my view/comments before about this issue but the comment wasn't featured. OVERALL - MY VERDICT? - Good value for money especially for people who have a lot of data to use, transfer & keep. LM
customer_reviews.author: LoyMachedo

customer_reviews.title: MacOS people - prepare to suffer
customer_reviews.text: I bought it on a simple guess that usb-c would mean top performance. Not even close! Crashes about 30% pf the time. I'm using it to store Adobe Lightroom catalog on a iMac. The performance is so painfully slow. When it's not randomly disconnecting! Definitely consider something better if you want more that just an archive storage.
customer_reviews.author: R.Z.

customer_reviews.title: LaCie drives have never let me down
customer_reviews.text: I vlog. I use a lot of hard drive space for someone who is not really making money from what I purchase these for. I have an array of LaCie Drives, but I use the 6TB drives for editing. The Thunderbolt 3's are great for speed and ease of use with a fairly recent MacBook Pro laptop. Love 'em.
customer_reviews.author: LSeerveld

customer_reviews.title: Impressive data rates
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these drives because I need additional space for images. I am connecting them to a 2013 Mac Pro which has Thunderbolt 2 ports. I was concerned about comments that the Apple Thunderbolt 3 to 2 device didn't work or had problems. What I have discovered is the device works fine for "powered devices" which includes the LaCie d2 drive. Still working on what needs to be done to daisy chain the second LaCie d2 disk.
customer_reviews.author: Coast Guy

customer_reviews.title: DOA... kind of.
customer_reviews.text: It arrived. And worked under the USB port, but NOT the Thunderbolt 3. So, to me, it is as good as DOA. Sending back for a refund. When things like this happen, it confirms my loyalty to Amazon. And it solidifies my negative view of LaCie.
customer_reviews.author: Randy K Burns

customer_reviews.title: Fast, efficient and dependable
customer_reviews.text: I have several of LaCie's products and they always prove trustworthy and this unit did not disappoint. I have a large amount of photos and video that I need to back up and store and all I need to do is plug this into my computer and drag the files onto it. Easy to organize files, view and retrieve.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Waters-Burghy

customer_reviews.title: Two different units spontaneously dismounting. Returned both.
customer_reviews.text: Bought one; it started spomtaneously dismounting itself from the Mac. Got a second one; mounted the two of them; they both spontaneously dismounted at the same time. No such problem with any of the other external drives. Sent them both back.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Bethune

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Doesn't take up too much room - but pricey
customer_reviews.text: Got this to go with new iMac and I like the sleeker size and quieter operation than my prior LaCie that was first generation thunderbolt connector. However, I hoped I could daisy chain the drive with my second monitor, but I can only do that in reverse (iMac, monitor, then drive) and that means I have to position the drive where I didn't want to, unless I buy a longer cable.
customer_reviews.author: Omaha Reader

customer_reviews.title: Ejects on Mac
customer_reviews.text: This drive will self-eject when your system sleeps. Even if you have files actively transferring and even if you have your Energy Saver sleep setting set to Never and uncheck Put hard disks to sleep when possible, the drive will still eject overnight or whenever you leave your system. Returning it and am going to look for another drive that works better on a Mac.
customer_reviews.author: Danger Press

customer_reviews.title: A great amount of storage but a little noisey
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to store music to use in my main audio system with Roon. It's worked fine and I have had no issues. It is a bit too noisy and I will need to figure out a way to have it be less audible in the room but otherwise its working fine. I have not had to use the tech services yet so I can't speak to how responsive they are at present.
customer_reviews.author: Elton J. Crim

customer_reviews.title: Computer Doesn’t Recognize
customer_reviews.text: Not working properly after one week. When I plug it up it doesn’t work right away. I have to keep fiddling with it. Most of the time my computer doesn’t recognize the hard drive. Would not recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Leanie

customer_reviews.title: It's incredibly noisy
customer_reviews.text: I'm almost beginning to think something is wrong with this drive. It is so noisy. Also wondering if you get the free 1 month of Adobe does that give them permission to access the drive? And is that why it is so noisy?
customer_reviews.author: Terri Larronde

customer_reviews.title: FAST drive with great connectivity options
customer_reviews.text: It's a FAST drive with Thunderbolt 3 and USB0C support, which means that you can daisy-chain other thunderbolt devices which is really nice to cut down on the number of cables hooked up to your machine.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas W Decker

customer_reviews.title: Reliable hard drive, used for Time Machine
customer_reviews.text: I have purchase an number LaCie external hard drives. This drive replaces a smaller 2 TB drive used for Time Machine backup. The blue light blinks on and off as the Time Machine is making the backup files. Very reassuring because the drive is very quiet otherwise. .
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: iMac perfect companion
customer_reviews.text: If you need extra storage this is the drive for you fast reads and writes and very quite drive!!!!!Cannot go wrong with LaCie!! Have one over 10 years now
customer_reviews.author: xorio

customer_reviews.title: Fast, High Quality Design
customer_reviews.text: Does not sustain the high speeds it advertises, but it's DEFINITELY faster than all my other external SSDs. Very high quality materials! I will keep buying these!
customer_reviews.author: A.Levister

customer_reviews.title: Great External HDD, Doesnt charge the macbook sometimes...
customer_reviews.text: Large capacity drive. FAST IO. replicated by 5 GB worth data storage system for backup. Just this one time, without changing the cable position on the drive, the Macbook stopped charging. and the transfer stopped as the computer went to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: G. Adibhatla

customer_reviews.title: Partitioned this drive to create 5 separate drivdes for photos ...
customer_reviews.text: Partitioned this drive to create 5 separate drivdes for photos, videos, documents and such. I own another LaCie, and have never had a problem with it; so I purchased another.
customer_reviews.author: NanaTech

customer_reviews.title: Returned these 2 and LaCie made good on it
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one and the red light kept coming on, indicating the fan was not working. Returned it for a 2nd one, but had to return that one also, for the connectors were loose and the thunderbolt cable would fall right out of the port. Returned these 2 and LaCie made good on it. Good customer support and took them back and sent me another one and this 3rd one works perfectly. Have had many of Lacie drives over the years, and never any problems before. But they made this one right so I'm happy and would order from LaCie again.
customer_reviews.author: Dave/Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Big storage in a little box
customer_reviews.text: Was able to move my entire photo catalog to this unit in a couple hours. In my workflow I do not work from the computer hard drive, I work off the External Drive and with the speed of this unit I am working fast and easy. Getting another for back up to complement my cloud storage.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Panebianco

customer_reviews.title: Great External Drive
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful aesthetic. Quite. Just that damn blue light! I had to make a vinyl wrap piece on the Cricut to cover it up.
customer_reviews.author: Ohmster

customer_reviews.title: works but is SLOW
customer_reviews.text: it works fine - but is SLOW - I'd expect faster speeds that are the point of Thunderbolt 3 and USB 3.1 - this is over 50% slower than my Thunderbolt 1 LaCie drive.
customer_reviews.author: KVT

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Works right out of the box and is very quiet. I wish it had external USB so I can chain to another drive.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Not withThunderbolt  2
customer_reviews.text: Would not work but the supplier immediately authorized a return with no fuss. More a problem with the available Apple adapter than the drive
customer_reviews.author: Timothy McEnroe

customer_reviews.title: Great Thunderbolt 3 ext HD
customer_reviews.text: I use 3 of these external drives for backing up all my data. They’re quiet and reliable! Thunderbolt speed and pass through are great!
customer_reviews.author: G. R. Overturf

customer_reviews.title: 10 TB Hard Drive by Lacie
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that it doesn't overheat too quickly, my other drive does & I always have to have a fan on it. Size matters when it comes to storage. :)
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: Did not work.
customer_reviews.text: DOA. Did not turn on do I had to return it. Amazon made the return a breeze so no complaints there.
customer_reviews.author: Magna

customer_reviews.title: I needed a extra hard drive for my PS4. ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed a extra hard drive for my PS4. I wasn't sure if it would connect to my PS4. So just in case I got the one with the lightning cable. Then I can use it on my Mac. PS4 did see the hard drive and it also saw all 8T. 8)
customer_reviews.author: Belish

customer_reviews.title: Died after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Whenever my iMac would wake up from sleep I’d receive the warning “Disk Not Ejected Properly.” This only happened to the lacie drive and not my external sandisk ssd. Eventually the drive failed and the blue light wouldn’t turn on anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Nice drive
customer_reviews.text: I liked the capacity of the drive although I will never have to worry about filling it up. I wish it had come with a Thunderbolt 3 cable vs the cable that was provided to hook up to my MacBook. For the price you should have gotten the Thunderbolt 3!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Wire not working
customer_reviews.text: I love the drive, but the usb-c cable doesn’t work with my brand new thunderbolt 3 Mac.
customer_reviews.author: Velikova

customer_reviews.title: plug and play with my mac!
customer_reviews.text: super easy set up with my mac no problems works great and is very quiet too!
customer_reviews.author: Chris D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: it's also great looking.
customer_reviews.text: So far, the drive is working as advertised. It's fast and allows daisy chaining with other Thuderbolt peripherals. As a bonus,it's also great looking.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Great for iTunes and video files
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to move video editing files, iTunes, and all other media off of my MacBook Pro. I have this connected via a thunderbolt connection on my external display. Very fast transfer and no problems to date. Also, it’s very quiet so it’s sitting on top of my desk, rather Han behind.
customer_reviews.author: Charley

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Solid drive and excellent transfer speeds. no drivers or software required, works with time machine, just great!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great brand great price.
customer_reviews.text: Love the drive I have 3 others from the same brand this was a ton of storage at a great price. I produce video professionally and these drives work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I returned it, since it wasn't a NAS
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to replace my old LACIE Nas. Didn't realize I was getting a desktop storage until I received it. Promptly returned it,
customer_reviews.author: blumma

customer_reviews.title: Failed after seven months, no wy to reach the manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: When the drive went down, it took 4TB of Jazz recordings I had digitized, a heartbreaker. I purchased the high priced drive for reliability and performance. I can get another name brand for just over half price, (albeit with a plastic case and at 5400RPM). Maybe I'll buy two and have a backup, but definitely not a LaCie.
customer_reviews.author: ordinary buyer

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of research prior to purchasing. Worth every penny. Using to back up my new 2017 5k IMAC and it’s like a wolf among sheep.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Zirkle

customer_reviews.title: Not quite 10TB
customer_reviews.text: Hasn't been heavily tested yet, but disappointed this isn't closer to the advertised 10TB. Mine is reading 9.09TB after being formatted.
customer_reviews.author: Alan A.

customer_reviews.title: Great hardrive
customer_reviews.text: This hardrive has huge storage and works fine. Editing 4k has been a breeze so far. Plug and play. Convenient and a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Violeta R.

customer_reviews.title: Works great and fast
customer_reviews.text: This external drive works great for storage and retrieval of my ~3 TB of photos. It's much faster (thunderbolt 3) than my 3 TB WD USB hard drives.
customer_reviews.author: robertN

customer_reviews.title: BEST hard drives for Wedding Photographers!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these LaCie hard drives for the past 7 years for my business and they are the best!!
customer_reviews.author: Christy Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great speed multi country
customer_reviews.text: Nice solid product. This does effect me but it comes with several cords that have plugs for different country so it can be used anywhere in the world without needing to buy an adapter. Super fast transfer and quite
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Died
customer_reviews.text: I have always had good luck with LaCie drives in the past but this one died after 6 months. Poor usb connection.
customer_reviews.author: R. L. Steeper

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Hdd light might get you a night in the dog house.
customer_reviews.text: Great item for the money. I got mine on sale. Would recommend! Write speeds were fair. Still going strong. Only downside is the blinking blue light. Drives my wife crazy I hade to put tape over it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert carter

customer_reviews.title: Would not mount
customer_reviews.text: I mounted the drive, started my file transfers then it just stopped transferring and unmounted. The drive would not mount again. I tried calling LaCie for support, but getting them on the phone was impossible.
customer_reviews.author: aaron.c

customer_reviews.title: I've been using the d2 drives for a while and ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the d2 drives for a while and, overall, they've been reliable. But this last one I got, after a week of use, the fan stopped working and make a loud whirring sound.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Inglin

customer_reviews.title: Great Backup System
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice, fast backup drive. It looks good and so far has been perfect. Very easy to install and set up with Time Machine.
customer_reviews.author: LA Reader

customer_reviews.title: great product - really wasteful packaging
customer_reviews.text: Great Hard Drive - super fast! - I love it!!! but why are 4x power cords from other regions included in this US box (see photo)? LaCie should have regional SKU's. This packaging guarantees 4 cords per unit are discarded.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan J. Mihelich

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: It's a little noisy at times. Oh well. First World problems.
customer_reviews.author: dilingo

customer_reviews.title: Fast and great so far
customer_reviews.text: Is my data storage drive. Fast and great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome storage!
customer_reviews.text: Working excellently! Keeping all of the most important files we have.
customer_reviews.author: kent m

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working after few months
customer_reviews.text: It stopped working after few months of use. The quality of the case and the connections are fragile. I will never buy a Lacie product again
customer_reviews.author: Ferchino

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay connected to the computer.
customer_reviews.text: On the phone for hours with LaCie. They have agreed to send a replacement. I don't have any great hopes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I will agree that the big blinking blue light is annoying but other than that
customer_reviews.text: The product formatted and loaded my data without question. I will agree that the big blinking blue light is annoying but other than that, it's doing just fine holding my photo archives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flashing blue light!
customer_reviews.text: I would like to reduce the intensity or even switch off the blue 'Operating' light on the front.
customer_reviews.author: Neil MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: don't trust there products, I bought 2 of them and they both lost all my work
customer_reviews.text: the first one I got lasted about 3 weeks, so I decided to buy a better one and that lost all my work for no reason. do your self a favor and buy something else
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: vote
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive came in the box only. It was not boxed up with any protectin. If drive does not work, I will need a new ASAP. I will keep you posted. Thank You
customer_reviews.author: kelly kroells

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Dependable
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great drive so far. Knowing a Seagate drive is built in is comforting as well.
customer_reviews.author: Keith R Sbiral

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Best hard drives on the market as long as you aren’t shuffling around.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Wilder

customer_reviews.title: Great unit, needs software update for Mac
customer_reviews.text: Connected to Late 2019 MacBook Pro. Great storage but, it ejects every time you’re hard disk goes to sleep. It’s annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Promise

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I think this is the perfect companion to my MacMini
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M. Swart

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like most everything about this product but the cable doesn't charge my MacBook Pro 17in. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Evan J.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The thunderbolt 3 cable not really good, all others quite good!
customer_reviews.author: Ky Thai

product_meta.title: LaCie d2 Thunderbolt 3 6TB External Hard Drive Desktop HDD – Thunderbolt 3 USB-C USB 3.0, 7200 RPM Enterprise Class Drives, for Mac and PC Desktop, 1 Month Adobe CC (STFY6000400)
product_meta.description: Style:Thunderbolt 3 / USB 3.1| Capacity:6TBThe LaCie D2 Thunderbolt 3 is the go-to external desktop hard drive for SSD-based laptops and all-in-one-computers powered by USB-C or Thunderbolt 3. Easily edit and archive large-scale projects with 6TB of capacity and speeds of up to 240MB/s. Seamlessly connect to USB-C computers and use the dual Thunderbolt 3 ports to daisy chain peripheral devices. The D2 Thunderbolt 3 comes equipped with Barracuda Pro enterprise-class drive for ultimate reliability and performance, And an aluminum enclosure for reduced noise and vibration. Enjoy long-term Peace of mind with the included five-year limited including rescue data recovery services.
feature_bullets: Professional speeds of up to 240MB/s; Minimum system requirements : Latest version of Windows 7, Windows 8 and Mac OS X 10.6.8 or later
Up to 10TB for large photo and video project storage and archive
USB C and dual Thunderbolt 3 ports for universal compatibility
Aluminum anybody for reduced noise and vibration
Includes 1 month complimentary membership to Adobe Creative Cloud All Apps Plan; Must redeem by January 31, 2020

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars303 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
